intro: Gynoxys albifluminis, commonly known as the white-flowered gynoxys, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
